0.21.text:
Hello and welcome to My Weekly Geekery, the show in which I
talk about what's been going on in my

3.35.text: geeky world over the past seven days.

4.75.text:
Top story today is that the Critics
Choice Television Awards were held last

8.36.text:
Breaking Bad won Best Drama Series,
Orange is the New Black won Best Comedy,

12.15.text:
and Fargo won Best Miniseries.
Acting awards went to, among others,

15.56.text: Matther McConaughey for True Detective, Tatiana Maslany for Orphan Black,

19.17.text: and Billy Bob Thornton for Fargo. I'll put a list to the full list of winners below.

22.69.text:
Seven new posters have been released for
the Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part

25.92.text:
1. They are propaganda pictures from the
Capitol and feature people from 7 Panem

30.45.text:
I really like them and will link to them below. A
new UK trailer has been released for

36.47.text: The film is out in the UK on 31st July, a day earlier than in the US,

39.96.text:
and I shall, again, put the link below. It
has been announced that Jack Coleman will be

43.87.text: appearing in Heroes Reborn, which is the new Heroes miniseries.

47.58.text: Coleman played Noah Bennet/Horn Rimmed Glasses in the original Heroes series, and

51.54.text:
is the first original cast member to be
announced to be returning.

54.54.text:
Louise Brealey has joined Ripper Street series 3. The
actress, best known for playing Molly Hooper

58.36.text: in Sherlock will be playing Dr Amelia Frayn.

60.98.text: The show is currently filming in Ireland, it will be on Amazon Prime

64.37.text:
Instant Video in autumn, and then on BBC1
after that. Paul McGann has stated that a

68.38.text: sequel to The Five(ish) Doctors Reboot

70.64.text:
is currently in production. The comedy short was
originally created for the fiftieth

74.13.text: anniversary of Doctor Who last year

75.80.text: and I'm pretty happy that a follow up is in the works.

78.90.text: And finally in 'Mouse mentions something which is on TV soon and which might be quite

82.42.text:
it's mainly Wimbledon in the World Cup
this week, but one of the things

85.43.text:
that is on is the finale of Fargo, on Sunday
the 22nd June at 9 p.m. on Channel 4.

89.74.text:
I have adored this series, it has been
outstanding and I am really sad to see

94.14.text:
So give it a watch if you haven't seen it
yet.

97.23.text: So good, so good. This has been My Weekly Geekery.
